metadata.title: CVE-2009-4078 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Redmine 0.8.5 andearlier allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

redmine - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-mysql - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-pgsql - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-sqlite - 0.9.0svn2902-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: redmine package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.0svn2902-1').
